pathAssistantSteps.info:
Review Smart Search Results:

  • Analyse the results from the initial Smart Search to determine if any flags (e.g., PEP, RCA, SIP, or other risks) have been identified.
  • Document the findings in the Case, including any details on flagged individuals or entities.

Escalate to Risk (if flagged):

  • If a PEP, RCA, SIP, or other risk flag is identified, escalate the Onboarding Case to the Risk Team for further review and approval.
  • Ensure all supporting documentation, including the CAF and Smart Search findings, are attached to the Case.

Trigger Form Approval (if no flags):

  • If no flags are raised during the Smart Search, the LC should proceed to trigger the Form Approval process.
  • Ensure that all required fields in the CAF are complete and accurate before submission.

Generate the Engagement Document:

  • The Lifecycle Coordinator (LC) is draft the Engagement Document

Engagement Document Approval:

  • Submit the Engagement Document for internal approval through the Engagement Pack Approval process.

Send to the Client:

  • Once approved, send the Engagement Document to the client using the Send from Docusign button on the Case
  • Clearly communicate the next steps to the client, including signing and returning the document.

If successful: Set the closure reason to Onboarded to indicate the client has been successfully onboarded.

If unsuccessful: Select an appropriate reason from the dropdown to document why the process did not proceed.

Review and Approve Flags:

  • The Risk Team will assess all flagged items identified during the initial Smart Search (e.g., PEP, RCA, SIP, or other concerns).
  • Review supporting documentation and ensure that all identified risks are clearly documented and addressed.
  • If additional information is required, return the Case to the Lifecycle Coordinator (LC) with specific questions or requests for clarification.

Partner Approval:

  • Send for Partner Approval using the Approval button on the Case

Compliance Approval:

  • Once Partner Approval is secured, automatically send the Case to the Risk Team to complete Compliance Approval.

Verify the escalation criteria: Ensure the Case meets the thresholds for escalation, such as the involvement of PEPs, RCAs, SIPs, or other flagged high-risk entities. Confirm all supporting documentation is complete and accurate.

Verify Onboarding Case details: Ensure all initial information in the Case is accurate and complete

Complete required forms:

  • For previously onboarded clients: Fill out and complete the Ongoing Monitoring Form based on their historical data and interactions.
  • For new clients: Generate and complete a Risk Assessment Form, ensuring all required details are captured.

Send Professional Clearance Letter (Audit Clients only):

  • If the client is an Audit client, send the Professional Clearance Letter to ensure compliance and initiate communication with the relevant parties.

Perform Smart Search checks:

  • Conduct initial Smart Search checks to identify potential risks, such as adverse media, sanctions, or other red flags

Assign a Lifecycle Coordinator (LC): Identify the LC currently working with the relevant partner on the Account. Assign this LC to the Case to ensure seamless coordination and relationship continuity.

Update Case Team: Add the assigned LC and other key stakeholders to the Case Team for visibility and collaboration.

Update Account Team: Verify that the relevant team members, including the partner's key contacts and the assigned LC, are logged in the Account Team.

Ensure on the Account that the Account Trading Currency, Tax Status, and Invoice Email are updated. For Audit clients only, update the Audit Categories. Accurate completion of these fields is essential for smooth onboarding and compliance. You can use the LC Update Button.
